data.content:
noun
plural sons of guns
US informal
[count] :a person (especially a man) or thing that you are annoyed with
That son of a gun never called me back.
I had to bring the car to the shop. The son of a gun broke down again.
old-fashioned - used by a man to address a male friend
How are you, you old son of a gun?
used to express mild surprise, disappointment, etc.
Son of a gun, I lost a button.
Well, son of a gun, you made it!
